intro: Haploclathra grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered haploclathra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It produces small, dark blue or black fruits that contain a single seed. Haploclathra grandiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth areas.
